messages.body:
06/11/05

Â 

Dear Mr. Zulu:

I am Manoel Arpoador, and the head of the recently formed International
Christian Alliance of Africa forwarded your message to me. I was amazed to hear
such a touching and sad story. Surely it was Jesus himself who put you in
contact with us. As Mr. Kleber is leaving tomorrow on a evangelyzing mission,
to Angola and Guine-Bissau, he asked me, as his secretary, to take charge of
all matters concerning financial arrangements. I am sure I can work out the
details in order to help you invest your inheritance overseas. Our Alliance
could surely benefit from any amount you would find honourable to donate, but
this is strictly a matter of your conscience. As Saint Peter said, "It is good
to receive, but it is Holy to give".

Yours in Jesus,

Manoel Arpoador

Dear Manoel Arpoador,

Thanks for your mail. I will love to invest our money in your country.it is where my late father advice me and my sister to invest our fund before his was assinated.i and my sister is very happy, as we believed that God have sent you to help me and my sister to invest for us.

I want to promise you that you will never be let down for your help.i and my sister have meet the foreign remittance director of the bank Dr Howard Sow with the Executive Director Mrs Vivian Ahmed, regarding the transfer of the fund to our foreign partner bank account for investment purpose.

The bank Director assured me and my sister that the fund will be wire / transfer direct to your bank account legitimately and legal Via : key telegraphic telex wire transfer within 48hrs, once you send you bank account details to they bank swifts telexs wire department for the transfer tp porceed immediately.

To enable they swift telex wire department, being the processing of the transfer to your bank account immediately their confirm your bank account details where their will transferred the total funds into.

He give me and my sister they bank contact details and advice us to send it to our foreign partner, to enable you to contact the bank immediately for the proccessing of the transfer .

HERE IS THE BANK CONTACT DETAILS BELOW:

Commercial Bank of Senegal (CBS) 
Tel + 221 664 81 87 / Fax + 221 826 42 60
E-mail:  cbs_info@cbszone.com
E-mail:  cbs_credit_telexs@cbszone.com
Contact Person Dr Howard Sow
Foreign Remittance Director

I want you to contact Dr Howard Sow, direct on telephone and then Tell him that you are contacting him on behalf of Mr Zulu Duru & sister on their deposited fund the total sum of $(12.500,000 usd).

Tell him that you are our foreign partner there , who will receive the deposited fund on our behalf.Ask him when the fund will be wired to your bank account and the next step to fellow regarding the transfer.

We are in the united nation refuge camp and the condtion of my mother here in the camp is not really good to us here because the camp is dirty for peoples like me and sister to stay. 

We want once the bank transfer the fund to your bank account, you will send me and my sister a letter of invation, to enable us to get and visa's and fly down there, once the bank trasfer the fund for the investment and for me to couniue my education in one of the university there .

I and my sister is awaiting for you full contact details /data to submit to the bank as soon as our foreign partner who will recieve the funds on our behalf , so could you please send to me and my sister your bank account urgently.

My sister is having high blood preasure after the death of my late father ,and too the refuge camp where i and my sister is staying for the moment is very far away from the cyber cafe internet ,where we send this mail to you.

Contact the Commercial Bank of Senegal (CBS) for more details regards the transfer .My sister is sending her greetings to you and your family.

Yours Truly Son,

Mr Zulu Duru.

messages.body:
07/11/05

Â 

Ah, Zulu, my son! I read your message aloud to our congregation and some of the people wept openly at the mention of the horrors of the refugee camp where your family is being kept. In fact, we happen to have in our board (in a honorary position) Mr. Manuel Alegre, a Portuguese poet and politician who happens to know very well the situation in Africa. As you know, our country, Portugal, had colonies there: Angola, Mozambique, GuineBissau... sad times.

Â 

But let me change the subject with good news: we can arrange for your immigration to Portugal! That's true! Mr. Alegre can provide you, your sister and your mother with a temporary 90-day visa, which can be renewed for two years. You only have to send us a scanned copy of your passport, where your name and photo can be clearly viewed. Should you like to travel with your sister and mother, send me their passport copies too. (Are they able to travel or should they wait for your arrival in Lisbon? You decide).
Send it to this e-mail, and I will arrange for our office in Luanda to provide the airplane ticket from TAP (Portuguese Airlines) and send it to you, so you can fly (via Luanda, of course) to Lisbon. Your passport number and photo are very important, as the only way to identify you amidst tens of thousands of crawling, rag-clothed, vermin-infested, fly-covered and wailing, desperateÂ  refugees. But don't despair: Jesus will help! Don't forget to provide us with your address, or a way to make the airplane ticket reach your hands.

Â 

I understand you will be able to refund our Mission for the expenses, as you will be in a position to claim the fortune your father left, after arriving in Lisbon. Please be aware that you will be invited to tell your story at our "Grande Festa EvangÃ©lica", a revival meeting we organize yearly to hear the testimonies of Our Lord Jesus in action, rescuing people from poverty and starvation.

Â 

I have sent Mr. Joaquim Pentelhino, our Finance Director, the details regarding the Commercial Bank of Senegal information. He will soon get in touch with Mr. Howard Sow. Meanwhile, he is preparing the purchase and booking of your tickets, and making hotel reservations in Lisbon. I asked for a three-star Hotel, called "Borges", at Rua Garrett, which is close to our headquarters at the Loreto Church. It has running water! And beds! And walls! Ah, Zulu, my son, what a change from the refugee camp! Tell your family help is on the way!

Â 

Yours in Jesus, and hoping to seeing you soon in the blessed land of Portugal,

Â 

Manoel Arpoador

Â

messages.body:
09/11/05

Â 

Dear Zulu, my son:

Â 

I am so sorry to hear that your sister is still ill. May God bless her with

health and a speedy transfer out of the refugee camp, with all those lizards,

flies, cockroaches and maggots. But I am sure she will be allright as soon as

she reaches a safe, clean town. I am happy to know you have your ID CARD, you

can scan it and send it to this e-mail.

Â Â 

DO IT AS SOON AS POSSIBLE! Only then the Mission can help you. We contacted TAP

and told them we will send you the money for the purchase of the ticket (Luanda

- Lisbon). You can choose the date, depending on your capability of leaving the

refugee camp and going to Luanda. We will be transferring also U$ 1.000, so you

can travel to Angola. The total will be U$ 2.143,56.

Â Â 

Mr. Manuel Alegre says your ID Card is enough to gain entrance to Portugal,

provided we have the date, time and flight of arrival, and a copy of your ID

card. This is essential, otherwise you can be deported! Thousands of illegal

immigrants arrive every year at Lisbon's airport, and face prison and

deportation.

Â Â 

I am sending a copy of this message to Dr Howard Sow, and I want to know if we

can transfer the U$ 2.143,56 to him, so he can give it to you. I understand you

prefer to bring your sister afterwards, when she recovers a little bit.

Â 
Â 
We can then work in the details of your investment. There are good opportunities

in the educational field in Portugal, and maybe you could sponsor a school for

ex-prostitutes that we maintain, to help these poor souls become nuns.
Â 
Â 

Hope, courage, Zulu! We await anxiously your answer, and news from your family.

Â Â 

Yours with Jesus,

Â Â 

M. Arpoador

Â Â

messages.body:
10/11/05
Â 
Â 

Zulu, my son, how good to know your sister is getting better. Did you tell her she will be starting a new life in Europe? Tell me her name, so I can include her in our prayers. God will help her recovery. Didn't Jesus help Lazarus? Well, I think her case is not so difficult, but who knows what terrible infections lurk in the desolate alleys of a refugee camp... come to think of it, upon your arrival maybe a short quarantine will be mandatory. But let us deal with it later.

Â Â 

I have contacted CBS and asked for the information which is necessary for us to transfer the funds that will allow you to reach our country. We are all very eager to see you in good health, amongst us. This will be proof that in this terrible times we're living, there is still place for kindness, compassion, trust and hope. I am awaiting your documentation, please read very carefully the message I have sent to Ms. Lilian Habib, Mr. Malick Diop and Dr. Howard Sow.

Â Â 

And now I end with a little pray: "Shall your days of waiting be as short as winter in the Dead Sea".
Â 
Â 

Yours in Jesus,

Â

10/11/05

Â 

Dear Lilian:

Â 

I am sending a copy of this message to Mr. Malick Diop and Dr. Howard Sow, concerning the transfer of the Duru mamily funds. However, there are two things I don't understand:

Â 

- whose "death certificate" are you asking me to provide? I don't think this is necessary for any of the arrangements. This is very weird. Maybe the message you sent me was intended to be sent to some relative of another recently deceased refugee who perished among flies, maggots, lizards and scorpions in a rat-infested, jackal-surrounded, vulture-haunted hole in the middle of the desert. But I digress.

Â 

- what was arranged with Mr Zulu Duru was the transfer of U$ 2,143.56 from the International

Christian Alliance of Africa to an account in your bank, provided you guarantee that the money can be delivered personally to him, so he can travel to Luanda and then fly to Lisbon, where he is to receive a temporary political refugee Visa.

Â 

Please understand that I am forced by the Alliance internal policy to conduct all our contacts via e-mail, so this is the reason I am not calling you. Also understand that you can wait till Mr Duru is safe in Portugal before you proceed with the transfer of his funds. We would prefer to open an account for him in our bank (BCP-Millenium, Chiado Branch) but his refugee condition would be revoked if the government discovered that he possesses so much money. So we will have to proceed afterwards with the transfer to our account.

Â 

In order to allow us to transfer the U$ 2,143.56, please provide us with all the details concerning the account of Mr. Howard Sow. We will also need a scanned image of his ID Card or passport, where his photo and ID number can be clearly viewed. This is due to the accounting practices adopted in the European Union following the attacks of September 11, 2001. I also asked the same documents from Mr. Zulu, and I printed his e-mail authorizing Mr. Sow to receive his airplane tickets money. Due to the sad and extreme conditions of his present situation, this will serve, in our files, as proof of his will to receive the money via Dr. Sow.

Â 

I also want to clarify that U$ 1,000 should be used to travel from Dakar to Luanda, and the rest (U$ 1,143.56) will pay for a TAP (Portuguese Airlines) airplane ticket to Lisbon. Please remind Mr. Duru that he has to present his ID card to TAP in order to purchase the ticket, and to inform the attendant he is travelling on a special arrangement involving the International Christian Alliance of Africa refugee program. This will circunvent the need of a passport, as his name has been sent to the TAP headquarters by Mr. Manuel Alegre.

Â 

HE MUSTN'T FORGET to tell us of his date, time and flight of arrival in Lisbon, so we can be waiting for him at the airport and help him during is interview with the immigration officers. THIS IS ESSENTIAL to avoid deportation!

Â 

Yours in Jesus, and waiting for the information requested,

Â 

Manoel Arpoador

Â

messages.body:
130/11/05

Â 

Dear Zulu and Tina, my children:

Â 

Bless God! I have already received the documents! I showed it around and everybody liked your faces, instantly. You seem so honest, so reliable! They asked me why your signatures are simply "Tina" and "Zulu", and I told them that in Africa people are not as worried as we are with genealogy or family names. Or maybe the manufacturing of the documents was made in a hurry, before the advance of the rebel troops, to escape the looting, raping and murdering frenzy of the machete-hurling, blood-hungry marauding teenage soldiers that have turned your country into a chaotic living hell.

Â 

As I explained before to Mr. Diop and to Mr. Sow, we would rather proceed with the transfer of your father's funds to Portugal AFTER you arrive safely in Lisbon, hopefully - God helping us - before the end of this month. Then you can contact CBS and pay the necessary taxes and bribes to Mr. Diop (he asked for $ 7,500.00 euros, which I personally find outrageous, because with half this ammount you could buy a whole province in Zaire); afterwards, you can order the deposit of the U$ 12,500,000.00 into our account. Do you mind if we set aside one percent - U$ 125,000 - as a donation to our Alliance? A small price to pay to flee from the refugee camp, don't you think so? And a big help to our effort to transform ex-prostitutes into nuns.

Â 

We had already prepared the transfer of the funds to CBS - the U$ 2,143.56 you will need to travel to Angola and catch the TAP flight to Lisbon - but Mr. Sow refused to provide a bank account, so we will have to ask Western Union to do it. You told us we could send him the money, but he said "NO" - take a look at what he said: "I AM UNABLE TO SENT YOU MY PRIVATE BANK ACCOUNT AND PASSPORT COPY / ID CARDÂ  BECAUSE THE NATURE OF MY JOB CONTRACT WITH THE (CBS) BANK THOSE NOT PERMIT MY PERSONAL CONTACTS TO BE INCLUDED ON THE BANK SIDE EITHER OR BY ASSISTANCE".

Â 

This is unheard of! The board of directors found it suspicious, because in Portugal money transfers to Africa using Western Union are usually preferred by shady, greasy, unshaven, sunglassed, flashy characters of the drug-traficking, prostitute-smuggling underworld. They wear long raincoats, gold earrings, grunt constantly and are very rude. Do you really trust Howard Sow? I happened to do a Google search on his bank and name and could not find any references. Why don't CBS have a domain name registered in Senegal? Is it really a bank or a ramshackle hut with ceiling ventilators, a derelict wooden table and a telephone salvaged from a third rate french-colonial drunk diplomat office? However, considering you are languishing in a refugee camp while your sister Tina rots in a canvas bed, you don't have many choices. That is what I told the directors, and they agreed to wire the money.

Â 

So Zulu, my son, please send me details for the wire transfer - we are not familiar with the proceedings of Western Union. Do we have to take the money there, or can we write a check? Don't forget to write when your money arrives, and remember to print the document I am attaching, to be presented to TAP airlines in Luanda. It is a letter of invitation, signed personaly by Mr. Jorge Sampaio, President of the Portuguese Republic. You will need your ID card, too.

Â 

Yours in Jesus and anxiously awaiting your arrival,

Â 

Manoel Arpoador

Â 
Â

Â Dear Scamorama:

Below is the end of my conversation with Mugu Mr. Zulu Duru, and I thought it would be interesting to enclose the TAP airlines ticket I sent him, so he could fly from Dakar to Lisbon and meet me. A much better forgery than the ones he sent me... I also manufactured a personal invitation from Portugal's President, so he could skip Immigration.

I wondered what would happen when he arrived at TAP's Dakar offices with this printout, looking for Ms. Maria Bucetagrande (BigCunt) or Mr. Joaquim Paupequeno (SmallPenis) to get his boarding pass. I thought he'd go there - because I hinted he could get a refund on the ticket I (allegedly) purchased. But he apparently made some enquiries...

I also hope your readers have as much fun as I had. I think I could go on and on insulting Zulu Duru, while he waited for the 500 euros, but I'd rather prepare for the next Mugu.

Keep up the good work.

messages.body:
15/11

Dear Zulu, your words regarding Dr. Sow are very wellcome. I was worried, because I learned the board of directors is conducting a secret investigation on this whole affair, and I had to submit all the information I have. They consulted with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and are very suspicious of CBS. I want to tell you here and now that regardless of the transfer of your late father's funds, the Alliance has agreed to help with the immigration of you and your sister. You don't imagine how ruthless these investigators are. They started to spread rumors, and to say I was to gain from the transfer of your millions to Portugal! I swore by my late grandmother's bones that all I was trying to do was to help a fellow-cristian, but they don't believe me! I can lose my job!

You understand that due to the investigation being carried by the auditors, we are unable to send any money via Western Union. But don't despair! Jesus and Nossa Senhora de FÃ¡tima are taking care of you and Tina!

What you will do is to proceed to the TAP offices in Luanda, present your ID card and the attached document and receive your airplane ticket. Mention the code "SOU#OTARIO#2005" to the attendant. There is a refund form to be filled by you, and right away you can receive the US$ 1,000 we promised to help you with your expenses when travelling from Dakar to Luanda. You see, we keep our word: my friend Paulo Portas, the TAP Angola manager, devised this plan to give you the money and charge us later. TAP has a daily flight from Luanda to Lisbon, so I didn't make any reservations. But don't forget to tell us your date, flight and time of arrival. Avoid being detained, searched, tortured, bound, gagged and deported.

ONLY ONE ticket is available, you will have to let Tina languishing in the refugee camp; after you arrive in Lisbon we will try to bring her too.  You see, it is like the movie "Sophie's Choice". You live. Tina rots. That's life. But when you are rich, maybe you decide to buy the refugee camp and turn it into a resort, Algarve-style, with golf courts, casino and private safari ranch, and a Tina Duru Memorial Crocodile Pond. She would probably do the same for you!

Please leave the refugee camp as soon as you can, because if you fail to travel to Portugal the investigators will blame me for everything, of inventing this whole story, of trying to illicitly transfer money abroad! Pray for me, son, so we can help you reach the safe, cristian shores of Portugal and later bring your sister and your father's money! 

Yours in Jesus,

Manoel Arpoador

17/11/2005

Zulu, I have the auditors on my back, my troubles are mounting, please don't
doubt our Alliance and my personal commitment! Remember Job had patience and
waited for God's deliverance from his troubles! Prepare for the good news!

It took me time and a lot of trouble, but I managed to arrange for the purchase
of a ticket from Dakar to Lisbon, WITHOUT PASSING THROUGH LUANDA, so you don't
have to spend your money. I was avoiding that... The problem is that the
Alliance still doesn't have an account with the TAP Dakar branch. I had to buy
the ticket with my own money. I know you are an honourable man, so I count on
you to refund me when you arrive. Another thing, you will have to pay the
airport tax in Dakar. It's around U$ 18.

I made the reservation and paid through the TAP website. Attached are the
details. Print it and go to the Dakar  Office / EscritÃ³rio TAP - Rue Amadou
Assane Ndoye, r/c 3. There you can look for Ms. Maria Bucetagrande (mornings)
or Mr. Joaquim Paupequeno (afternoons). Mention the Code S0U#8URR0, present the
reservation details, your ID card and the invitation I sent you before, and they
will give you your ticket. Your plane leaves on Friday, November 25, at 02:55;
TAP flight number 210. It means that you have to be at Yoff airport on Sunday,
before midnight. Don't arrive late or you will lose the plane! If this happens,
the refund is only 80% of the price! We lose 20% and will probably have to
remain in Dakar!

I suggest you take these few days before leaving Senegal to pray and say goodbye
to your friends in the refugee camp. Please tell them how Jesus delivered you
from misery and squalor, and how they should convert from worshiping twigs and
ants into Christianity.

I will be waiting for you in Lisbon, at the airport. I am sending an attached
photo, so you can recognize me. I will not be alone, so please don't mention
anything about the millions your father left. It is our secret, many people are
not to be trusted, even in a religious organization. You must know that, living
in a refugee camp where people would murder their own family for a roasted
lizard leg...

Your plane arrives at 06:40 in the morning. We can have breakfast together and
then proceed to the Alliance headquarters, at the Loreto Church, where a few of
the members will be waiting. Again, please don't mention the money. For all
purposes, I helped you just out of christian compassion. We will surprise them
when you announce that you will be helping with the building of an orphanage!
But let us first bring the money to Portugal, with the help of Mr Sow and Mr.
Diop.

Another thing, because of the auditors investigation, we will not be able to use
the Alliance's account, so we will have to transfer the money to my personal
account. But we can take care of it later.

Yours in Jesus, and praying for a happy deliverance,

Manoel Arpoador
